content:
New forum post: {{ moar forum to the forum }}.
Feedback, assistance, comments, etc. welcome. Jump in! :smile: :heart:

@BWPanda (Peter) do you have acccess to do these things; https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/659 ?

Send "New Forum Post" messages to Zulip · Issue #659 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We currently get automatic notifications in Gitter whenever a user posts a new topic in the forum. We'd like to move that functionality to Zulip. research zulip api implement logic f.b.org modu...
I believe so

New forum post: Zulip notification test (ignore me).
Feedback, assistance, comments, etc. welcome. Jump in! :smile: :heart:
Great! And a question – does it make sense to start new "Topics" in the Forum "Stream" using the title of the forum post?

Well, the intention is to draw the attention of people, and then have them respond with a comment in the respective actual forum post - not to start a discussion/chat in Zulip. ...that's my understanding at least.
Agreed. I don't see real value in having topics for each post. As @klonos says, the goal is to have the answer to the question in the forum, not here.
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++
(serundeputy)** :-) (Karma: 5)
I do like having these notifications is a different stream (as they are), so they are opt in instead of opt out.

New forum post: Integration.
Feedback, assistance, comments, etc. welcome. Jump in! :smile: :heart:
I don't have strong feelings on it, just was curious where the discussion was best to take place. (E.g. forum kept cleaner with q and a, and less chatter there). The current setup sounds fine to me.

Yeah, there isn't much ...we seem to be getting the odd 1 to 3 spam messages every week or so ...our current spam filtering does a pretty good job, but it'd be easier if we had more people doing the occasional manual clean up when some spam slips through :wink:

I will create a new release of Unique Field module. It can work only with Backdrop 1.15.0 or newer versions. Have I to insert this line into the .info file?: dependencies[] = system (>=1.15.0)
(Related forum post: Unique Field. )

Yes. There are a lot of examples here: https://api.backdropcms.org/modules#info-files
Scroll down to the "dependencies (Optional)" section.
